    8350           0 : inline auto isWhitespace(char c) -> bool {
    8351           0 :         static std::string chars = " \t\n\r";
    8352           0 :         return chars.find(c) != std::string::npos;
    8353             : }
    8354           0 : inline auto isBreakableBefore(char c) -> bool {
    8355           0 :         static std::string chars = "[({<|";
    8356           0 :         return chars.find(c) != std::string::npos;
    8357             : }
    8358           0 : inline auto isBreakableAfter(char c) -> bool {
    8359           0 :         static std::string chars = "])}>.,:;*+-=&/\\";
    8360           0 :         return chars.find(c) != std::string::npos;
    8361             : }
    8362             : 
    8363             : class Columns;
    8364             : 
    8365           0 : class Column {
    8366             :         std::vector<std::string> m_strings;
    8367             :         size_t m_width = CATCH_CLARA_TEXTFLOW_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH;
    8368             :         size_t m_indent = 0;
    8369             :         size_t m_initialIndent = std::string::npos;
    8370             : 
    8371             : public:
    8372             :         class iterator {
    8373             :                 friend Column;
    8374             : 
    8375             :                 Column const& m_column;
    8376             :                 size_t m_stringIndex = 0;
    8377             :                 size_t m_pos = 0;
    8378             : 
    8379             :                 size_t m_len = 0;
    8380             :                 size_t m_end = 0;
    8381             :                 bool m_suffix = false;
    8382             : 
    8383           0 :                 iterator(Column const& column, size_t stringIndex)
    8384           0 :                         : m_column(column),
    8385           0 :                         m_stringIndex(stringIndex) {}
    8386             : 
    8387           0 :                 auto line() const -> std::string const& { return m_column.m_strings[m_stringIndex]; }
    8388             : 
    8389           0 :                 auto isBoundary(size_t at) const -> bool {
    8390           0 :                         assert(at > 0);
    8391           0 :                         assert(at <= line().size());
    8392             : 
    8393           0 :                         return at == line().size() ||
    8394           0 :                                 (isWhitespace(line()[at]) && !isWhitespace(line()[at - 1])) ||
    8395           0 :                                 isBreakableBefore(line()[at]) ||
    8396           0 :                                 isBreakableAfter(line()[at - 1]);
    8397             :                 }
    8398             : 
    8399           0 :                 void calcLength() {
    8400           0 :                         assert(m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size());
    8401             : 
    8402           0 :                         m_suffix = false;
    8403           0 :                         auto width = m_column.m_width - indent();
    8404           0 :                         m_end = m_pos;
    8405           0 :                         if (line()[m_pos] == '\n') {
    8406           0 :                                 ++m_end;
    8407             :                         }
    8408           0 :                         while (m_end < line().size() && line()[m_end] != '\n')
    8409           0 :                                 ++m_end;
    8410             : 
    8411           0 :                         if (m_end < m_pos + width) {
    8412           0 :                                 m_len = m_end - m_pos;
    8413             :                         } else {
    8414           0 :                                 size_t len = width;
    8415           0 :                                 while (len > 0 && !isBoundary(m_pos + len))
    8416           0 :                                         --len;
    8417           0 :                                 while (len > 0 && isWhitespace(line()[m_pos + len - 1]))
    8418           0 :                                         --len;
    8419             : 
    8420           0 :                                 if (len > 0) {
    8421           0 :                                         m_len = len;
    8422             :                                 } else {
    8423           0 :                                         m_suffix = true;
    8424           0 :                                         m_len = width - 1;
    8425             :                                 }
    8426             :                         }
    8427           0 :                 }
    8428             : 
    8429           0 :                 auto indent() const -> size_t {
    8430           0 :                         auto initial = m_pos == 0 && m_stringIndex == 0 ? m_column.m_initialIndent : std::string::npos;
    8431           0 :                         return initial == std::string::npos ? m_column.m_indent : initial;
    8432             :                 }
    8433             : 
    8434           0 :                 auto addIndentAndSuffix(std::string const &plain) const -> std::string {
    8435           0 :                         return std::string(indent(), ' ') + (m_suffix ? plain + "-" : plain);
    8436             :                 }
    8437             : 
    8438             :         public:
    8439             :                 using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
    8440             :                 using value_type = std::string;
    8441             :                 using pointer = value_type * ;
    8442             :                 using reference = value_type & ;
    8443             :                 using iterator_category = std::forward_iterator_tag;

    8445           0 :                 explicit iterator(Column const& column) : m_column(column) {
    8446           0 :                         assert(m_column.m_width > m_column.m_indent);

    8448           0 :                         calcLength();

    8450           0 :                                 m_stringIndex++; // Empty string
    8451           0 :                 }
    8452             :

    8454           0 :                         assert(m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size());

    8456           0 :                         return addIndentAndSuffix(line().substr(m_pos, m_len));
    8457             :                 }
    8458             : 
    8459           0 :                 auto operator ++() -> iterator& {
    8460           0 :                         m_pos += m_len;

    8462           0 :                                 m_pos += 1;
    8463             :                         else
    8464           0 :                                 while (m_pos < line().size() && isWhitespace(line()[m_pos]))
    8465           0 :                                         ++m_pos;
    8466             :

    8468           0 :                                 m_pos = 0;
    8469           0 :                                 ++m_stringIndex;

    8472           0 :                                 calcLength();

    8578           0 :                 }

    8581             :                         return m_iterators == other.m_iterators;

    8584           0 :                         return m_iterators != other.m_iterators;
    8585             :                 }

    8587           0 :                         std::string row, padding;

    8590           0 :                                 auto width = m_columns[i].width();

    8592           0 :                                         std::string col = *m_iterators[i];

    8594           0 :                                         if (col.size() < width)
    8595           0 :                                                 padding = std::string(width - col.size(), ' ');
    8596             :                                         else

    8598             :                                 } else {
    8599           0 :                                         padding += std::string(width, ' ');
    8600             :                                 }
    8601             :                         }
    8602           0 :                         return row;
    8603             :                 }

    8605           0 :                         for (size_t i = 0; i < m_columns.size(); ++i) {
    8606           0 :                                 if (m_iterators[i] != m_columns[i].end())
    8607           0 :                                         ++m_iterators[i];
    8608             :                         }

    8676             : namespace Catch { namespace clara {
    8677             : namespace detail {
    8678             : 
    8679             :     // Traits for extracting arg and return type of lambdas (for single argument lambdas)
    8680             :     template<typename L>
    8681             :     struct UnaryLambdaTraits : UnaryLambdaTraits<decltype( &L::operator() )> {};
    8682             :

    8718             :     // Wraps a token coming from a token stream. These may not directly correspond to strings as a single string
    8719             :     // may encode an option + its argument if the : or = form is used

    8721             :         Option, Argument
    8722             :     };
    8723           0 :     struct Token {
    8724             :         TokenType type;
    8725             :         std::string token;
    8726             :     };

    8728           0 :     inline auto isOptPrefix( char c ) -> bool {
    8729           0 :         return c == '-'
    8730             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    8731             :             || c == '/'
    8732             : #endif
    8733             :         ;
    8734             :     }
    8735             : 
    8736             :     // Abstracts iterators into args as a stream of tokens, with option arguments uniformly handled
    8737           9 :     class TokenStream {
    8738             :         using Iterator = std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator;
    8739             :         Iterator it;
    8740             :         Iterator itEnd;
    8741             :         std::vector<Token> m_tokenBuffer;
    8742             : 
    8743           1 :         void loadBuffer() {
    8744           1 :             m_tokenBuffer.resize( 0 );
    8745             : 
    8746             :             // Skip any empty strings
    8747           1 :             while( it != itEnd && it->empty() )
    8748           0 :                 ++it;
    8749             : 
    8750           1 :             if( it != itEnd ) {
    8751           0 :                 auto const &next = *it;
    8752           0 :                 if( isOptPrefix( next[0] ) ) {
    8753           0 :                     auto delimiterPos = next.find_first_of( " :=" );
    8754           0 :                     if( delimiterPos != std::string::npos ) {
    8755           0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, next.substr( 0, delimiterPos ) } );
    8756           0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Argument, next.substr( delimiterPos + 1 ) } );
    8757             :                     } else {
    8758           0 :                         if( next[1] != '-' && next.size() > 2 ) {
    8759           0 :                             std::string opt = "- ";
    8760           0 :                             for( size_t i = 1; i < next.size(); ++i ) {
    8761           0 :                                 opt[1] = next[i];
    8762           0 :                                 m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, opt } );
    8763             :                             }
    8764             :                         } else {
    8765           0 :                             m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, next } );
    8766             :                         }
    8767             :                     }
    8768             :                 } else {
    8769           0 :                     m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Argument, next } );
    8770             :                 }
    8771             :             }
    8772           1 :         }
    8773             : 
    8774             :     public:
    8775           1 :         explicit TokenStream( Args const &args ) : TokenStream( args.m_args.begin(), args.m_args.end() ) {}
    8776             : 
    8777           1 :         TokenStream( Iterator it, Iterator itEnd ) : it( it ), itEnd( itEnd ) {
    8778           1 :             loadBuffer();
    8779           1 :         }
    8780             : 
    8781           1 :         explicit operator bool() const {
    8782           1 :             return !m_tokenBuffer.empty() || it != itEnd;
    8783             :         }
    8784             : 
    8785             :         auto count() const -> size_t { return m_tokenBuffer.size() + (itEnd - it); }
    8786             : 
    8787           0 :         auto operator*() const -> Token {
    8788           0 :             assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    8789           0 :             return m_tokenBuffer.front();
    8790             :         }
    8791             : 
    8792           0 :         auto operator->() const -> Token const * {
    8793           0 :             assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    8794           0 :             return &m_tokenBuffer.front();
    8795             :         }
    8796             : 
    8797           0 :         auto operator++() -> TokenStream & {
    8798           0 :             if( m_tokenBuffer.size() >= 2 ) {
    8799           0 :                 m_tokenBuffer.erase( m_tokenBuffer.begin() );
    8800             :             } else {
    8801           0 :                 if( it != itEnd )
    8802           0 :                     ++it;
    8803           0 :                 loadBuffer();
    8804             :             }
    8805           0 :             return *this;
    8806             :         }
    8807             :     };

    8945           0 :         std::stringstream ss;

    8947           0 :         ss >> target;

    8950             :         else

    8954           1 :         target = source;

    8957           0 :     inline auto convertInto( std::string const &source, bool &target ) -> ParserResult {
    8958           0 :         std::string srcLC = source;

    8961           0 :             target = true;
    8962           0 :         else if (srcLC == "n" || srcLC == "0" || srcLC == "false" || srcLC == "no" || srcLC == "off")
    8963           0 :             target = false;
    8964             :         else
    8965           0 :             return ParserResult::runtimeError( "Expected a boolean value but did not recognise: '" + source + "'" );

    9787           0 :     bool SourceLineInfo::operator == ( SourceLineInfo const& other ) const noexcept {
    9788           0 :         return line == other.line && (file == other.file || std::strcmp(file, other.file) == 0);
    9789             :     }

    9791             :         // We can assume that the same file will usually have the same pointer.
    9792             :         // Thus, if the pointers are the same, there is no point in calling the strcmp
    9793           0 :         return line < other.line || ( line == other.line && file != other.file && (std::strcmp(file, other.file) < 0));

    9958             :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    9959             :                 case Colour::None:      return setTextAttribute( originalForegroundAttributes );

    9975             :

    9977             :                     CATCH_ERROR( "Unknown colour requested" );

   10014             :     // use POSIX/ ANSI console terminal codes
   10015             :     // Thanks to Adam Strzelecki for original contribution
   10016             :     // (http://github.com/nanoant)
   10017             :     // https://github.com/philsquared/Catch/pull/131
   10018           1 :     class PosixColourImpl : public IColourImpl {
   10019             :     public:
   10020           8 :         void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) override {
   10021           8 :             switch( _colourCode ) {
   10022           4 :                 case Colour::None:
   10023           4 :                 case Colour::White:     return setColour( "[0m" );
   10024           0 :                 case Colour::Red:       return setColour( "[0;31m" );
   10025           0 :                 case Colour::Green:     return setColour( "[0;32m" );
   10026           0 :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setColour( "[0;34m" );
   10027           0 :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setColour( "[0;36m" );
   10028           0 :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setColour( "[0;33m" );
   10029           0 :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setColour( "[1;30m" );
   10030             : 
   10031           0 :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setColour( "[0;37m" );
   10032           1 :                 case Colour::BrightRed:     return setColour( "[1;31m" );
   10033           2 :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setColour( "[1;32m" );
   10034           0 :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setColour( "[1;37m" );
   10035           1 :                 case Colour::BrightYellow:  return setColour( "[1;33m" );
   10036             : 
   10037           0 :                 case Colour::Bright: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "not a colour" );
   10038           0 :                 default: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown colour requested" );

   10040             :         }

   10109           8 :         static IColourImpl* impl = platformColourInstance();
   10110             :         // Strictly speaking, this cannot possibly happen.
   10111             :         // However, under some conditions it does happen (see #1626),
   10112             :         // and this change is small enough that we can let practicality
   10113             :         // triumph over purity in this case.
   10114           8 :         if (impl != NULL) {
   10115           8 :             impl->use( _colourCode );
   10116             :         }
   10117           8 :     }

   10163             :     private:
   10164             :         IConfigPtr m_config;
   10165             :         IRunner* m_runner = nullptr;
   10166             :         IResultCapture* m_resultCapture = nullptr;
   10167             :     };

   10230             : // start catch_debugger.cpp
   10231             : 
   10232             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
   10233             : 
   10234             : #  include <assert.h>
   10235             : #  include <stdbool.h>
   10236             : #  include <sys/types.h>
   10237             : #  include <unistd.h>
   10238             : #  include <cstddef>
   10239             : #  include <ostream>
   10240             : 
   10241             : #ifdef __apple_build_version__
   10242             :     // These headers will only compile with AppleClang (XCode)
   10243             :     // For other compilers (Clang, GCC, ... ) we need to exclude them
   10244             : #  include <sys/sysctl.h>
   10245             : #endif
   10246             : 
   10247             :     namespace Catch {
   10248             :         #ifdef __apple_build_version__
   10249             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
   10250             :         // https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/qa/qa1361/_index.html
   10251             : 
   10252             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
   10253             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
   10254             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
   10255             :             int                 mib[4];
   10256             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
   10257             :             std::size_t         size;
   10258             : 
   10259             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
   10260             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
   10261             : 
   10262             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
   10263             : 
   10264             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
   10265             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
   10266             : 
   10267             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
   10268             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
   10269             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
   10270             :             mib[3] = getpid();
   10271             : 
   10272             :             // Call sysctl.
   10273             : 
   10274             :             size = sizeof(info);
   10275             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, nullptr, 0) != 0 ) {
   10276             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
   10277             :                 return false;
   10278             :             }
   10279             : 
   10280             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
   10281             : 
   10282             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
   10283             :         }
   10284             :         #else
   10285             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
   10286             :             // We need to find another way to determine this for non-appleclang compilers on macOS
   10287             :             return false;
   10288             :         }
   10289             :         #endif
   10290             :     } // namespace Catch
   10291             : 
   10292             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
   10293             :     #include <fstream>
   10294             :     #include <string>
   10295             : 
   10296             :     namespace Catch{
   10297             :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
   10298             :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
   10299             :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
   10300             :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
   10301             :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
   10302             :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
   10303             :         // there instead.
   10304           0 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
   10305             :             // Libstdc++ has a bug, where std::ifstream sets errno to 0
   10306             :             // This way our users can properly assert over errno values
   10307           0 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
   10308           0 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
   10309           0 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
   10310             :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
   10311           0 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
   10312             :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
   10313             :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
   10314             :                     // character.
   10315           0 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
   10316             :                 }
   10317             :             }
   10318             : 
   10319           0 :             return false;
   10320             :         }
   10321             :     } // namespace Catch
   10322             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
   10323             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
   10324             :     namespace Catch {
   10325             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
   10326             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
   10327             :         }
   10328             :     }
   10329             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
   10330             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
   10331             :     namespace Catch {
   10332             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
   10333             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
   10334             :         }
   10335             :     }
   10336             : #else
   10337             :     namespace Catch {
   10338             :        bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
   10339             :     }
   10340             : #endif // Platform
   10341             : // end catch_debugger.cpp
   10342             : // start catch_decomposer.cpp
   10343             : 
   10344             : namespace Catch {
   10345             : 
   10346             :     ITransientExpression::~ITransientExpression() = default;
   10347             : 
   10348           0 :     void formatReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os, std::string const& lhs, StringRef op, std::string const& rhs ) {
   10349           0 :         if( lhs.size() + rhs.size() < 40 &&
   10350           0 :                 lhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos &&
   10351           0 :                 rhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos )
   10352           0 :             os << lhs << " " << op << " " << rhs;
   10353             :         else
   10354           0 :             os << lhs << "\n" << op << "\n" << rhs;
   10355           0 :     }
   10356             : }
   10357             : // end catch_decomposer.cpp

   10423             :     namespace Detail {
   10424             : 
   10425             :         namespace {
   10426             :             // Extracts the actual name part of an enum instance
   10427             :             // In other words, it returns the Blue part of Bikeshed::Colour::Blue
   10428           0 :             StringRef extractInstanceName(StringRef enumInstance) {
   10429             :                 // Find last occurence of ":"
   10430           0 :                 size_t name_start = enumInstance.size();
   10431           0 :                 while (name_start > 0 && enumInstance[name_start - 1] != ':') {
   10432           0 :                     --name_start;
   10433             :                 }
   10434           0 :                 return enumInstance.substr(name_start, enumInstance.size() - name_start);
   10435             :             }
   10436             :         }
   10437             : 
   10438           0 :         std::vector<StringRef> parseEnums( StringRef enums ) {
   10439           0 :             auto enumValues = splitStringRef( enums, ',' );
   10440           0 :             std::vector<StringRef> parsed;
   10441           0 :             parsed.reserve( enumValues.size() );

   10443           0 :                 parsed.push_back(trim(extractInstanceName(enumValue)));
   10444             :             }
   10445           0 :             return parsed;
   10446             :         }

   10453           0 :                     return valueToName.second;

   10522           0 :     void ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::registerTranslator( const IExceptionTranslator* translator ) {
   10523           0 :         m_translators.push_back( std::unique_ptr<const IExceptionTranslator>( translator ) );
   10524           0 :     }
   10525             : 
   10526             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
   10527           0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
   10528             :         try {
   10529             : #ifdef __OBJC__
   10530             :             // In Objective-C try objective-c exceptions first
   10531             :             @try {
   10532             :                 return tryTranslators();
   10533             :             }
   10534             :             @catch (NSException *exception) {
   10535             :                 return Catch::Detail::stringify( [exception description] );
   10536             :             }
   10537             : #else
   10538             :             // Compiling a mixed mode project with MSVC means that CLR
   10539             :             // exceptions will be caught in (...) as well. However, these
   10540             :             // do not fill-in std::current_exception and thus lead to crash
   10541             :             // when attempting rethrow.
   10542             :             // /EHa switch also causes structured exceptions to be caught
   10543             :             // here, but they fill-in current_exception properly, so
   10544             :             // at worst the output should be a little weird, instead of
   10545             :             // causing a crash.
   10546           0 :             if (std::current_exception() == nullptr) {
   10547           0 :                 return "Non C++ exception. Possibly a CLR exception.";
   10548             :             }
   10549           0 :             return tryTranslators();
   10550             : #endif
   10551             :         }
   10552           0 :         catch( TestFailureException& ) {
   10553           0 :             std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
   10554             :         }
   10555           0 :         catch( std::exception& ex ) {
   10556           0 :             return ex.what();
   10557             :         }
   10558           0 :         catch( std::string& msg ) {
   10559           0 :             return msg;
   10560             :         }
   10561           0 :         catch( const char* msg ) {
   10562           0 :             return msg;
   10563             :         }
   10564           0 :         catch(...) {
   10565           0 :             return "Unknown exception";
   10566             :         }
   10567             :     }
   10568             : 
   10569           0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::tryTranslators() const {
   10570           0 :         if (m_translators.empty()) {
   10571           0 :             std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
   10572             :         } else {
   10573           0 :             return m_translators[0]->translate(m_translators.begin() + 1, m_translators.end());
   10574             :         }
   10575             :     }
   10576             : 
   10577             : #else // ^^ Exceptions are enabled // Exceptions are disabled vv
   10578             :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
   10579             :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Attempted to translate active exception under CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS!");
   10580             :     }
   10581             :

   10589             : // start catch_fatal_condition.cpp
   10590             : 
   10591             : #if defined(__GNUC__)

   10593             : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmissing-field-initializers"
   10594             : #endif
   10595             : 
   10596             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH ) || defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
   10597             : 
   10598             : namespace {
   10599             :     // Report the error condition
   10600           0 :     void reportFatal( char const * const message ) {
   10601           0 :         Catch::getCurrentContext().getResultCapture()->handleFatalErrorCondition( message );
   10602           0 :     }
   10603             : }
   10604             : 
   10605             : #endif // signals/SEH handling
   10606             : 
   10607             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH )
   10608             : 
   10609             : namespace Catch {
   10610             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
   10611             : 
   10612             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
   10613             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
   10614             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
   10615             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
   10616             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION),  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
   10617             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW), "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
   10618             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION), "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
   10619             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO), "Divide by zero error" },
   10620             :     };
   10621             : 
   10622             :     LONG CALLBACK FatalConditionHandler::handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
   10623             :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
   10624             :             if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == def.id) {
   10625             :                 reportFatal(def.name);
   10626             :             }
   10627             :         }
   10628             :         // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
   10629             :         // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
   10630             :         return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
   10631             :     }
   10632             : 
   10633             :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
   10634             :         isSet = true;
   10635             :         // 32k seems enough for Catch to handle stack overflow,
   10636             :         // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
   10637             :         guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
   10638             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
   10639             :         // Register as first handler in current chain
   10640             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
   10641             :         // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
   10642             :         SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
   10643             :     }
   10644             : 
   10645             :     void FatalConditionHandler::reset() {
   10646             :         if (isSet) {
   10647             :             RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
   10648             :             SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
   10649             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
   10650             :             isSet = false;
   10651             :         }
   10652             :     }
   10653             : 
   10654             :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
   10655             :         reset();
   10656             :     }
   10657             : 
   10658             : bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
   10659             : ULONG FatalConditionHandler::guaranteeSize = 0;
   10660             : PVOID FatalConditionHandler::exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
   10661             : 
   10662             : } // namespace Catch
   10663             : 
   10664             : #elif defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
   10665             : 
   10666             : namespace Catch {
   10667             : 
   10668             :     struct SignalDefs {
   10669             :         int id;
   10670             :         const char* name;
   10671             :     };
   10672             : 
   10673             :     // 32kb for the alternate stack seems to be sufficient. However, this value
   10674             :     // is experimentally determined, so that's not guaranteed.
   10675             :     static constexpr std::size_t sigStackSize = 32768 >= MINSIGSTKSZ ? 32768 : MINSIGSTKSZ;
   10676             : 
   10677             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
   10678             :         { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
   10679             :         { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
   10680             :         { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
   10681             :         { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
   10682             :         { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
   10683             :         { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
   10684             :     };
   10685             : 
   10686           0 :     void FatalConditionHandler::handleSignal( int sig ) {
   10687           0 :         char const * name = "<unknown signal>";
   10688           0 :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
   10689           0 :             if (sig == def.id) {
   10690           0 :                 name = def.name;
   10691           0 :                 break;
   10692             :             }
   10693             :         }
   10694           0 :         reset();
   10695           0 :         reportFatal(name);
   10696           0 :         raise( sig );
   10697           0 :     }
   10698             : 
   10699          53 :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
   10700          53 :         isSet = true;
   10701             :         stack_t sigStack;
   10702          53 :         sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
   10703          53 :         sigStack.ss_size = sigStackSize;
   10704          53 :         sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
   10705          53 :         sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
   10706          53 :         struct sigaction sa = { };
   10707             : 
   10708          53 :         sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
   10709          53 :         sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
   10710         371 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
   10711         318 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
   10712             :         }
   10713          53 :     }
   10714             : 
   10715          53 :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
   10716          53 :         reset();
   10717          53 :     }
   10718             : 
   10719         106 :     void FatalConditionHandler::reset() {
   10720         106 :         if( isSet ) {
   10721             :             // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
   10722         371 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i ) {
   10723         318 :                 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
   10724             :             }
   10725             :             // Return the old stack
   10726          53 :             sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
   10727          53 :             isSet = false;
   10728             :         }
   10729         106 :     }
   10730             :

   11042           0 :     std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
   11043           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
   11044           0 :         if( config.hasTestFilters() )
   11045           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
   11046             :         else {
   11047           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
   11048             :         }
   11049             : 
   11050           0 :         auto matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
   11051           0 :         for( auto const& testCaseInfo : matchedTestCases ) {
   11052           0 :             Colour::Code colour = testCaseInfo.isHidden()
   11053           0 :                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
   11054           0 :                 : Colour::None;
   11055           0 :             Colour colourGuard( colour );
   11056             : 
   11057           0 :             Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.name ).initialIndent( 2 ).indent( 4 ) << "\n";
   11058           0 :             if( config.verbosity() >= Verbosity::High ) {
   11059           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( Catch::Detail::stringify( testCaseInfo.lineInfo ) ).indent(4) << std::endl;
   11060           0 :                 std::string description = testCaseInfo.description;
   11061           0 :                 if( description.empty() )
   11062           0 :                     description = "(NO DESCRIPTION)";
   11063           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( description ).indent(4) << std::endl;
   11064             :             }
   11065           0 :             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
   11066           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString() ).indent( 6 ) << "\n";
   11067             :         }
   11068             : 
   11069           0 :         if( !config.hasTestFilters() )
   11070           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTestCases.size(), "test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
   11071             :         else
   11072           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTestCases.size(), "matching test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
   11073           0 :         return matchedTestCases.size();
   11074             :     }
   11075             : 
   11076           0 :     std::size_t listTestsNamesOnly( Config const& config ) {
   11077           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();

   11081           0 :             matchedTests++;
   11082           0 :             if( startsWith( testCaseInfo.name, '#' ) )
   11083           0 :                Catch::cout() << '"' << testCaseInfo.name << '"';
   11084             :             else

   11086           0 :             if ( config.verbosity() >= Verbosity::High )
   11087           0 :                 Catch::cout() << "\t@" << testCaseInfo.lineInfo;
   11088           0 :             Catch::cout() << std::endl;
   11089             :         }
   11090           0 :         return matchedTests;
   11091             :     }
   11092             :

   11101             :             // Add 2 for the brackes

   11103             :         }
   11104             : 
   11105           0 :         std::string out; out.reserve(size);

   11107           0 :             out += '[';
   11108           0 :             out += spelling;
   11109           0 :             out += ']';
   11110             :         }
   11111           0 :         return out;
   11112             :     }
   11113             : 
   11114           0 :     std::size_t listTags( Config const& config ) {
   11115           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
   11116           0 :         if( config.hasTestFilters() )
   11117           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Tags for matching test cases:\n";
   11118             :         else {
   11119           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available tags:\n";
   11120             :         }
   11121             : 
   11122           0 :         std::map<std::string, TagInfo> tagCounts;
   11123             : 
   11124           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );

   11126           0 :             for( auto const& tagName : testCase.getTestCaseInfo().tags ) {
   11127           0 :                 std::string lcaseTagName = toLower( tagName );
   11128           0 :                 auto countIt = tagCounts.find( lcaseTagName );
   11129           0 :                 if( countIt == tagCounts.end() )
   11130           0 :                     countIt = tagCounts.insert( std::make_pair( lcaseTagName, TagInfo() ) ).first;
   11131           0 :                 countIt->second.add( tagName );
   11132             :             }
   11133             :         }
   11134             : 
   11135           0 :         for( auto const& tagCount : tagCounts ) {
   11136           0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   11137           0 :             rss << "  " << std::setw(2) << tagCount.second.count << "  ";
   11138           0 :             auto str = rss.str();
   11139           0 :             auto wrapper = Column( tagCount.second.all() )
   11140           0 :                                                     .initialIndent( 0 )
   11141           0 :                                                     .indent( str.size() )
   11142           0 :                                                     .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-10 );
   11143           0 :             Catch::cout() << str << wrapper << '\n';
   11144             :         }
   11145           0 :         Catch::cout() << pluralise( tagCounts.size(), "tag" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
   11146           0 :         return tagCounts.size();
   11147             :     }
   11148             : 
   11149           0 :     std::size_t listReporters() {

   11153           0 :         for( auto const& factoryKvp : factories )
   11154           0 :             maxNameLen = (std::max)( maxNameLen, factoryKvp.first.size() );
   11155             : 
   11156           0 :         for( auto const& factoryKvp : factories ) {
   11157             :             Catch::cout()
   11158           0 :                     << Column( factoryKvp.first + ":" )
   11159           0 :                             .indent(2)
   11160           0 :                             .width( 5+maxNameLen )
   11161           0 :                     +  Column( factoryKvp.second->getDescription() )
   11162           0 :                             .initialIndent(0)
   11163           0 :                             .indent(2)
   11164           0 :                             .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - maxNameLen-8 )
   11165           0 :                     << "\n";
   11166             :         }
   11167           0 :         Catch::cout() << std::endl;
   11168           0 :         return factories.size();
   11169             :     }
   11170             : 
   11171           1 :     Option<std::size_t> list( std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config ) {
   11172           1 :         Option<std::size_t> listedCount;
   11173           1 :         getCurrentMutableContext().setConfig( config );
   11174           1 :         if( config->listTests() )
   11175           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTests( *config );
   11176           1 :         if( config->listTestNamesOnly() )
   11177           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTestsNamesOnly( *config );
   11178           1 :         if( config->listTags() )
   11179           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTags( *config );
   11180           1 :         if( config->listReporters() )
   11181           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listReporters();
   11182           1 :         return listedCount;
   11183             :     }

   11195           0 :                 m_cachedToString = describe();

   11276           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &f, sizeof(f));

   11278             :     }

   11280           0 :     int64_t convert(double d) {
   11281             :         static_assert(sizeof(double) == sizeof(int64_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");
   11282             :         int64_t i;
   11283           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &d, sizeof(d));
   11284           0 :         return i;
   11285             :     }
   11286             : 
   11287             :     template <typename FP>
   11288           0 :     bool almostEqualUlps(FP lhs, FP rhs, uint64_t maxUlpDiff) {
   11289             :         // Comparison with NaN should always be false.
   11290             :         // This way we can rule it out before getting into the ugly details
   11291           0 :         if (Catch::isnan(lhs) || Catch::isnan(rhs)) {
   11292           0 :             return false;
   11293             :         }
   11294             : 
   11295           0 :         auto lc = convert(lhs);
   11296           0 :         auto rc = convert(rhs);
   11297             : 
   11298           0 :         if ((lc < 0) != (rc < 0)) {
   11299             :             // Potentially we can have +0 and -0
   11300           0 :             return lhs == rhs;
   11301             :         }
   11302             : 
   11303           0 :         auto ulpDiff = std::abs(lc - rc);
   11304           0 :         return static_cast<uint64_t>(ulpDiff) <= maxUlpDiff;
   11305             :     }
   11306             : 
   11307             : } //end anonymous namespace
   11308             : 
   11309             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER)
   11310             : 
   11311             : #if defined(__clang__)
   11312             : #pragma clang diagnostic push
   11313             : // The long double overload is currently unused
   11314             : #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunused-function"
   11315             : #endif
   11316             : 
   11317             :     float nextafter(float x, float y) {
   11318             :         return ::nextafterf(x, y);
   11319             :     }
   11320             : 
   11321             :     double nextafter(double x, double y) {
   11322             :         return ::nextafter(x, y);
   11323             :     }
   11324             : 
   11325             :     long double nextafter(long double x, long double y) {
   11326             :         return ::nextafterl(x, y);
   11327             :     }

   11329             : #if defined(__clang__)

   11331             : #endif
   11332             : 
   11333             : #endif // ^^^ CATCH_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER ^^^
   11334             : 
   11335             : namespace {
   11336             : 
   11337             : template <typename FP>
   11338           0 : FP step(FP start, FP direction, uint64_t steps) {
   11339           0 :     for (uint64_t i = 0; i < steps; ++i) {
   11340             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER)
   11341             :         start = Catch::nextafter(start, direction);
   11342             : #else
   11343           0 :         start = std::nextafter(start, direction);
   11344             : #endif
   11345             :     }
   11346           0 :     return start;
   11347             : }
   11348             : 
   11349             : // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
   11350             : // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
   11351           0 : bool marginComparison(double lhs, double rhs, double margin) {
   11352           0 :     return (lhs + margin >= rhs) && (rhs + margin >= lhs);
   11353             : }
   11354             : 
   11355             : template <typename FloatingPoint>

   11357           0 :     out << std::scientific
   11358           0 :         << std::setprecision(std::numeric_limits<FloatingPoint>::max_digits10 - 1)
   11359             :         << num;
   11360           0 : }
   11361             :

   11401           0 :     bool WithinUlpsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
   11402           0 :         switch (m_type) {
   11403           0 :         case FloatingPointKind::Float:
   11404           0 :             return almostEqualUlps<float>(static_cast<float>(matchee), static_cast<float>(m_target), m_ulps);

   11406           0 :             return almostEqualUlps<double>(matchee, m_target, m_ulps);
   11407           0 :         default:
   11408           0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown FloatingPointKind value" );
   11409             :         }
   11410             :     }

   11416           0 :     std::string WithinUlpsMatcher::describe() const {

   11420             :

   11430           0 :             write(ret, step(m_target, static_cast<double>(-INFINITY), m_ulps));
   11431           0 :             ret << ", ";
   11432           0 :             write(ret, step(m_target, static_cast<double>( INFINITY), m_ulps));
   11433             :         } else {

   11666           0 :             getResultCapture().popScopedMessage(m_info);
   11667             :         }
   11668           0 :     }
   11669             : 
   11670           0 :     Capturer::Capturer( StringRef macroName, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, ResultWas::OfType resultType, StringRef names ) {
   11671           0 :         auto trimmed = [&] (size_t start, size_t end) {
   11672           0 :             while (names[start] == ',' || isspace(names[start])) {
   11673           0 :                 ++start;
   11674             :             }
   11675           0 :             while (names[end] == ',' || isspace(names[end])) {
   11676           0 :                 --end;
   11677             :             }
   11678           0 :             return names.substr(start, end - start + 1);
   11679           0 :         };
   11680           0 :         auto skipq = [&] (size_t start, char quote) {
   11681           0 :             for (auto i = start + 1; i < names.size() ; ++i) {
   11682           0 :                 if (names[i] == quote)
   11683           0 :                     return i;
   11684           0 :                 if (names[i] == '\\')
   11685           0 :                     ++i;
   11686             :             }
   11687           0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("CAPTURE parsing encountered unmatched quote");
   11688           0 :         };
   11689             : 
   11690           0 :         size_t start = 0;
   11691           0 :         std::stack<char> openings;
   11692           0 :         for (size_t pos = 0; pos < names.size(); ++pos) {
   11693           0 :             char c = names[pos];
   11694           0 :             switch (c) {
   11695           0 :             case '[':
   11696             :             case '{':
   11697             :             case '(':
   11698             :             // It is basically impossible to disambiguate between
   11699             :             // comparison and start of template args in this context
   11700             : //            case '<':
   11701           0 :                 openings.push(c);
   11702           0 :                 break;
   11703           0 :             case ']':
   11704             :             case '}':
   11705             :             case ')':
   11706             : //           case '>':
   11707           0 :                 openings.pop();
   11708           0 :                 break;
   11709           0 :             case '"':
   11710             :             case '\'':
   11711           0 :                 pos = skipq(pos, c);
   11712           0 :                 break;
   11713           0 :             case ',':
   11714           0 :                 if (start != pos && openings.size() == 0) {
   11715           0 :                     m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
   11716           0 :                     m_messages.back().message = static_cast<std::string>(trimmed(start, pos));
   11717           0 :                     m_messages.back().message += " := ";
   11718           0 :                     start = pos;
   11719             :                 }
   11720             :             }
   11721             :         }
   11722           0 :         assert(openings.size() == 0 && "Mismatched openings");
   11723           0 :         m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
   11724           0 :         m_messages.back().message = static_cast<std::string>(trimmed(start, names.size() - 1));
   11725           0 :         m_messages.back().message += " := ";
   11726           0 :     }
   11727           0 :     Capturer::~Capturer() {
   11728           0 :         if ( !uncaught_exceptions() ){
   11729           0 :             assert( m_captured == m_messages.size() );
   11730           0 :             for( size_t i = 0; i < m_captured; ++i  )
   11731           0 :                 m_resultCapture.popScopedMessage( m_messages[i] );
   11732             :         }
   11733           0 :     }
   11734             : 
   11735           0 :     void Capturer::captureValue( size_t index, std::string const& value ) {
   11736           0 :         assert( index < m_messages.size() );
   11737           0 :         m_messages[index].message += value;
   11738           0 :         m_resultCapture.pushScopedMessage( m_messages[index] );
   11739           0 :         m_captured++;
   11740           0 :     }

   11774             :     // StdErr has two constituent streams in C++, std::cerr and std::clog

   11776             :     // order of writes

   11803             : 
   11804             :     // Windows's implementation of std::tmpfile is terrible (it tries
   11805             :     // to create a file inside system folder, thus requiring elevated
   11806             :     // privileges for the binary), so we have to use tmpnam(_s) and
   11807             :     // create the file ourselves there.
   11808             :     class TempFile {
   11809             :     public:
   11810             :         TempFile(TempFile const&) = delete;

   11824             :         char m_buffer[L_tmpnam] = { 0 };
   11825             :     #endif
   11826             :     };

   11953             :         m_originalStdout(dup(1)),
   11954             :         m_originalStderr(dup(2)),
   11955             :         m_stdoutDest(stdout_dest),
   11956             :         m_stderrDest(stderr_dest) {
   11957             :         dup2(fileno(m_stdoutFile.getFile()), 1);
   11958             :         dup2(fileno(m_stderrFile.getFile()), 2);
   11959             :     }
   11960             : 
   11961             :     OutputRedirect::~OutputRedirect() {
   11962             :         Catch::cout() << std::flush;
   11963             :         fflush(stdout);
   11964             :         // Since we support overriding these streams, we flush cerr
   11965             :         // even though std::cerr is unbuffered
   11966             :         Catch::cerr() << std::flush;
   11967             :         Catch::clog() << std::flush;
   11968             :         fflush(stderr);
   11969             : 
   11970             :         dup2(m_originalStdout, 1);
   11971             :         dup2(m_originalStderr, 2);
   11972             : 
   11973             :         m_stdoutDest += m_stdoutFile.getContents();
   11974             :         m_stderrDest += m_stderrFile.getContents();
   11975             :     }

   12020             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12021             : #pragma warning(push)
   12022             : #pragma warning(disable:4146) // we negate uint32 during the rotate
   12023             : #endif
   12024             :         // Safe rotr implementation thanks to John Regehr
   12025           0 :         uint32_t rotate_right(uint32_t val, uint32_t count) {
   12026           0 :             const uint32_t mask = 31;
   12027           0 :             count &= mask;
   12028           0 :             return (val >> count) | (val << (-count & mask));
   12029             :         }
   12030             : 
   12031             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12032             : #pragma warning(pop)
   12033             : #endif
   12034             : 
   12035             : }
   12036             : 
   12037           0 :     SimplePcg32::SimplePcg32(result_type seed_) {
   12038           0 :         seed(seed_);
   12039           0 :     }
   12040             : 
   12041           0 :     void SimplePcg32::seed(result_type seed_) {
   12042           0 :         m_state = 0;
   12043           0 :         (*this)();
   12044           0 :         m_state += seed_;
   12045           0 :         (*this)();
   12046           0 :     }
   12047             : 
   12048           0 :     void SimplePcg32::discard(uint64_t skip) {
   12049             :         // We could implement this to run in O(log n) steps, but this
   12050             :         // should suffice for our use case.
   12051           0 :         for (uint64_t s = 0; s < skip; ++s) {
   12052           0 :             static_cast<void>((*this)());
   12053             :         }
   12054           0 :     }
   12055             : 
   12056           0 :     SimplePcg32::result_type SimplePcg32::operator()() {
   12057             :         // prepare the output value
   12058           0 :         const uint32_t xorshifted = static_cast<uint32_t>(((m_state >> 18u) ^ m_state) >> 27u);
   12059           0 :         const auto output = rotate_right(xorshifted, m_state >> 59u);
   12060             : 
   12061             :         // advance state
   12062           0 :         m_state = m_state * 6364136223846793005ULL + s_inc;
   12063             : 
   12064           0 :         return output;
   12065             :     }
   12066             : 
   12067           0 :     bool operator==(SimplePcg32 const& lhs, SimplePcg32 const& rhs) {
   12068           0 :         return lhs.m_state == rhs.m_state;
   12069             :     }
   12070             : 
   12071           0 :     bool operator!=(SimplePcg32 const& lhs, SimplePcg32 const& rhs) {
   12072           0 :         return lhs.m_state != rhs.m_state;
   12073             :     }
   12074             : }

   12220             :         virtual ~ISingleton();

   12224             :     void cleanupSingletons();
   12225             : 
   12226             :     template<typename SingletonImplT, typename InterfaceT = SingletonImplT, typename MutableInterfaceT = InterfaceT>
   12227           3 :     class Singleton : SingletonImplT, public ISingleton {
   12228             : 
   12229          62 :         static auto getInternal() -> Singleton* {
   12230             :             static Singleton* s_instance = nullptr;
   12231          62 :             if( !s_instance ) {
   12232           1 :                 s_instance = new Singleton;
   12233           1 :                 addSingleton( s_instance );
   12234             :             }
   12235          62 :             return s_instance;
   12236             :         }
   12237             : 
   12238             :     public:
   12239           5 :         static auto get() -> InterfaceT const& {
   12240           5 :             return *getInternal();
   12241             :         }
   12242          57 :         static auto getMutable() -> MutableInterfaceT& {
   12243          57 :             return *getInternal();
   12244             :         }
   12245             :     };

   12695          53 :     void RunContext::runCurrentTest(std::string & redirectedCout, std::string & redirectedCerr) {
   12696          53 :         auto const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
   12697         106 :         SectionInfo testCaseSection(testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name);
   12698          53 :         m_reporter->sectionStarting(testCaseSection);
   12699          53 :         Counts prevAssertions = m_totals.assertions;
   12700          53 :         double duration = 0;
   12701          53 :         m_shouldReportUnexpected = true;
   12702          53 :         m_lastAssertionInfo = { "TEST_CASE"_sr, testCaseInfo.lineInfo, StringRef(), ResultDisposition::Normal };
   12703             : 
   12704          53 :         seedRng(*m_config);
   12705             : 
   12706          53 :         Timer timer;
   12707             :         CATCH_TRY {
   12708          53 :             if (m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut) {
   12709             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_REDIRECT)
   12710           0 :                 RedirectedStreams redirectedStreams(redirectedCout, redirectedCerr);
   12711             :

   12715             :                 OutputRedirect r(redirectedCout, redirectedCerr);
   12716             :                 timer.start();
   12717             :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
   12718             : #endif
   12719             :             } else {
   12720          53 :                 timer.start();
   12721          53 :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
   12722             :             }
   12723          53 :             duration = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
   12724           0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ANON (TestFailureException&) {
   12725             :             // This just means the test was aborted due to failure
   12726           0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ALL {
   12727             :             // Under CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE, unexpected exceptions under REQUIRE assertions
   12728             :             // are reported without translation at the point of origin.
   12729           0 :             if( m_shouldReportUnexpected ) {
   12730           0 :                 AssertionReaction dummyReaction;
   12731           0 :                 handleUnexpectedInflightException( m_lastAssertionInfo, translateActiveException(), dummyReaction );
   12732             :             }
   12733             :         }

   12735          53 :         bool missingAssertions = testForMissingAssertions(assertions);

   12745             : 
   12746          53 :     void RunContext::invokeActiveTestCase() {
   12747         106 :         FatalConditionHandler fatalConditionHandler; // Handle signals
   12748          53 :         m_activeTestCase->invoke();

   13034             : 
   13035             :             // On older platforms, returning std::unique_ptr<ListeningReporter>
   13036             :             // when the return type is std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>
   13037             :             // doesn't compile without a std::move call. However, this causes
   13038             :             // a warning on newer platforms. Thus, we have to work around
   13039             :             // it a bit and downcast the pointer manually.
   13040           0 :             auto ret = std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>(new ListeningReporter);
   13041           0 :             auto& multi = static_cast<ListeningReporter&>(*ret);
   13042           0 :             auto const& listeners = Catch::getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getListeners();

   13044           0 :                 multi.addListener(listener->create(Catch::ReporterConfig(config)));
   13045             :             }
   13046           0 :             multi.addReporter(createReporter(config->getReporterName(), config));

   13050           1 :         class TestGroup {
   13051             :         public:
   13052           1 :             explicit TestGroup(std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config)
   13053           1 :             : m_config{config}
   13054           1 :             , m_context{config, makeReporter(config)}

   13077             :                     else
   13078           0 :                         m_context.reporter().skipTest(*testCase);
   13079             :                 }

   13081           1 :                 for (auto const& match : m_matches) {
   13082           0 :                     if (match.tests.empty()) {
   13083           0 :                         m_context.reporter().noMatchingTestCases(match.name);

   13261           1 :     int Session::runInternal() {
   13262           1 :         if( m_startupExceptions )
   13263           0 :             return 1;
   13264             : 
   13265           1 :         if (m_configData.showHelp || m_configData.libIdentify) {
   13266           0 :             return 0;
   13267             :         }
   13268             : 
   13269             :         CATCH_TRY {
   13270           1 :             config(); // Force config to be constructed
   13271             : 
   13272           1 :             seedRng( *m_config );
   13273             : 
   13274           1 :             if( m_configData.filenamesAsTags )
   13275           0 :                 applyFilenamesAsTags( *m_config );
   13276             : 
   13277             :             // Handle list request
   13278           2 :             if( Option<std::size_t> listed = list( m_config ) )
   13279           0 :                 return static_cast<int>( *listed );
   13280             : 
   13281           2 :             TestGroup tests { m_config };
   13282           1 :             auto const totals = tests.execute();
   13283             : 
   13284           1 :             if( m_config->warnAboutNoTests() && totals.error == -1 )
   13285           0 :                 return 2;
   13286             : 
   13287             :             // Note that on unices only the lower 8 bits are usually used, clamping
   13288             :             // the return value to 255 prevents false negative when some multiple
   13289             :             // of 256 tests has failed
   13290           1 :             return (std::min) (MaxExitCode, (std::max) (totals.error, static_cast<int>(totals.assertions.failed)));

   13564             : 
   13565         106 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();
   13566             :     }
   13567             : 
   13568           0 :     StringRef trim(StringRef ref) {
   13569           0 :         const auto is_ws = [](char c) {
   13570           0 :             return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c == '\r';
   13571           0 :         };
   13572           0 :         size_t real_begin = 0;
   13573           0 :         while (real_begin < ref.size() && is_ws(ref[real_begin])) { ++real_begin; }
   13574           0 :         size_t real_end = ref.size();
   13575           0 :         while (real_end > real_begin && is_ws(ref[real_end - 1])) { --real_end; }
   13576             : 
   13577           0 :         return ref.substr(real_begin, real_end - real_begin);
   13578             :     }

   13580           0 :     bool replaceInPlace( std::string& str, std::string const& replaceThis, std::string const& withThis ) {
   13581           0 :         bool replaced = false;
   13582           0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );

   13584           0 :             replaced = true;
   13585           0 :             str = str.substr( 0, i ) + withThis + str.substr( i+replaceThis.size() );

   13587           0 :                 i = str.find( replaceThis, i+withThis.size() );
   13588             :             else
   13589           0 :                 i = std::string::npos;
   13590             :         }
   13591           0 :         return replaced;
   13592             :     }

   13778         159 :         TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties parseSpecialTag( std::string const& tag ) {
   13779         318 :             if( startsWith( tag, '.' ) ||
   13780         159 :                 tag == "!hide" )
   13781           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::IsHidden;
   13782         159 :             else if( tag == "!throws" )
   13783           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::Throws;
   13784         159 :             else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
   13785           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
   13786         159 :             else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
   13787           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
   13788         159 :             else if( tag == "!nonportable" )
   13789           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;

   13796          53 :             return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( static_cast<unsigned char>(tag[0]) );

   14159          53 :     void TrackerBase::close() {
   14160             : 
   14161             :         // Close any still open children (e.g. generators)
   14162          53 :         while( &m_ctx.currentTracker() != this )
   14163           0 :             m_ctx.currentTracker().close();
   14164             : 
   14165          53 :         switch( m_runState ) {
   14166           0 :             case NeedsAnotherRun:
   14167           0 :                 break;
   14168             : 
   14169          53 :             case Executing:
   14170          53 :                 m_runState = CompletedSuccessfully;
   14171          53 :                 break;
   14172           0 :             case ExecutingChildren:
   14173           0 :                 if( std::all_of(m_children.begin(), m_children.end(), [](ITrackerPtr const& t){ return t->isComplete(); }) )
   14174           0 :                     m_runState = CompletedSuccessfully;
   14175           0 :                 break;
   14176             : 
   14177           0 :             case NotStarted:
   14178             :             case CompletedSuccessfully:
   14179             :             case Failed:
   14180           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Illogical state: " << m_runState );
   14181             : 
   14182           0 :             default:
   14183           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown state: " << m_runState );
   14184             :         }
   14185          53 :         moveToParent();
   14186          53 :         m_ctx.completeCycle();
   14187          53 :     }

   14263          53 :     void SectionTracker::addNextFilters( std::vector<std::string> const& filters ) {

   14265           0 :             m_filters.insert( m_filters.end(), filters.begin()+1, filters.end() );

   14400           0 :     TestSpecParser& TestSpecParser::parse( std::string const& arg ) {
   14401           0 :         m_mode = None;
   14402           0 :         m_exclusion = false;
   14403           0 :         m_arg = m_tagAliases->expandAliases( arg );

   14408             : 
   14409           0 :         for( m_pos = 0; m_pos < m_arg.size(); ++m_pos )
   14410             :           //if visitChar fails
   14411           0 :            if( !visitChar( m_arg[m_pos] ) ){
   14412           0 :                m_testSpec.m_invalidArgs.push_back(arg);
   14413           0 :                break;
   14414             :            }
   14415           0 :         endMode();
