   14417             :     }
   14418           1 :     TestSpec TestSpecParser::testSpec() {
   14419           1 :         addFilter();
   14420           1 :         return m_testSpec;
   14421             :     }
   14422           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::visitChar( char c ) {
   14423           0 :         if( (m_mode != EscapedName) && (c == '\\') ) {
   14424           0 :             escape();
   14425           0 :             addCharToPattern(c);
   14426           0 :             return true;
   14427           0 :         }else if((m_mode != EscapedName) && (c == ',') )  {
   14428           0 :             return separate();
   14429             :         }
   14430             : 
   14431           0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
   14432           0 :         case None:
   14433           0 :             if( processNoneChar( c ) )
   14434           0 :                 return true;
   14435           0 :             break;
   14436           0 :         case Name:
   14437           0 :             processNameChar( c );
   14438           0 :             break;
   14439           0 :         case EscapedName:
   14440           0 :             endMode();
   14441           0 :             addCharToPattern(c);
   14442           0 :             return true;
   14443           0 :         default:
   14444             :         case Tag:
   14445             :         case QuotedName:
   14446           0 :             if( processOtherChar( c ) )
   14447           0 :                 return true;
   14448           0 :             break;
   14449             :         }
   14450             : 
   14451           0 :         m_substring += c;
   14452           0 :         if( !isControlChar( c ) ) {
   14453           0 :             m_patternName += c;
   14454           0 :             m_realPatternPos++;
   14455             :         }
   14456           0 :         return true;
   14457             :     }
   14458             :     // Two of the processing methods return true to signal the caller to return
   14459             :     // without adding the given character to the current pattern strings
   14460           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::processNoneChar( char c ) {
   14461           0 :         switch( c ) {
   14462           0 :         case ' ':
   14463           0 :             return true;
   14464           0 :         case '~':
   14465           0 :             m_exclusion = true;
   14466           0 :             return false;
   14467           0 :         case '[':
   14468           0 :             startNewMode( Tag );
   14469           0 :             return false;
   14470           0 :         case '"':
   14471           0 :             startNewMode( QuotedName );
   14472           0 :             return false;
   14473           0 :         default:
   14474           0 :             startNewMode( Name );
   14475           0 :             return false;
   14476             :         }
   14477             :     }
   14478           0 :     void TestSpecParser::processNameChar( char c ) {
   14479           0 :         if( c == '[' ) {
   14480           0 :             if( m_substring == "exclude:" )
   14481           0 :                 m_exclusion = true;
   14482             :             else
   14483           0 :                 endMode();
   14484           0 :             startNewMode( Tag );
   14485             :         }
   14486           0 :     }
   14487           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::processOtherChar( char c ) {
   14488           0 :         if( !isControlChar( c ) )
   14489           0 :             return false;
   14490           0 :         m_substring += c;
   14491           0 :         endMode();
   14492           0 :         return true;
   14493             :     }
   14494           0 :     void TestSpecParser::startNewMode( Mode mode ) {
   14495           0 :         m_mode = mode;
   14496           0 :     }
   14497           0 :     void TestSpecParser::endMode() {
   14498           0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
   14499           0 :         case Name:
   14500             :         case QuotedName:
   14501           0 :             return addPattern<TestSpec::NamePattern>();
   14502           0 :         case Tag:
   14503           0 :             return addPattern<TestSpec::TagPattern>();
   14504           0 :         case EscapedName:
   14505           0 :             revertBackToLastMode();
   14506           0 :             return;
   14507           0 :         case None:
   14508             :         default:
   14509           0 :             return startNewMode( None );
   14510             :         }
   14511             :     }
   14512           0 :     void TestSpecParser::escape() {
   14513           0 :         saveLastMode();
   14514           0 :         m_mode = EscapedName;
   14515           0 :         m_escapeChars.push_back(m_realPatternPos);
   14516           0 :     }
   14517           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::isControlChar( char c ) const {
   14518           0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
   14519           0 :             default:
   14520           0 :                 return false;
   14521           0 :             case None:
   14522           0 :                 return c == '~';
   14523           0 :             case Name:
   14524           0 :                 return c == '[';
   14525           0 :             case EscapedName:
   14526           0 :                 return true;
   14527           0 :             case QuotedName:
   14528           0 :                 return c == '"';
   14529           0 :             case Tag:
   14530           0 :                 return c == '[' || c == ']';
   14531             :         }
   14532             :     }
   14533             : 
   14534           1 :     void TestSpecParser::addFilter() {
   14535           1 :         if( !m_currentFilter.m_patterns.empty() ) {
   14536           0 :             m_testSpec.m_filters.push_back( m_currentFilter );
   14537           0 :             m_currentFilter = TestSpec::Filter();
   14538             :         }
   14539           1 :     }
   14540             : 
   14541           0 :     void TestSpecParser::saveLastMode() {
   14542           0 :       lastMode = m_mode;
   14543           0 :     }
   14544             : 
   14545           0 :     void TestSpecParser::revertBackToLastMode() {
   14546           0 :       m_mode = lastMode;
   14547           0 :     }
   14548             : 
   14549           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::separate() {
   14550           0 :       if( (m_mode==QuotedName) || (m_mode==Tag) ){
   14551             :          //invalid argument, signal failure to previous scope.
   14552           0 :          m_mode = None;
   14553           0 :          m_pos = m_arg.size();
   14554           0 :          m_substring.clear();
   14555           0 :          m_patternName.clear();
   14556           0 :          return false;
   14557             :       }
   14558           0 :       endMode();
   14559           0 :       addFilter();
   14560           0 :       return true; //success
   14561             :     }
   14562             :

   14569             : // start catch_timer.cpp
   14570             : 
   14571             : #include <chrono>
   14572             : 
   14573             : static const uint64_t nanosecondsInSecond = 1000000000;
   14574             : 
   14575             : namespace Catch {
   14576             : 
   14577         106 :     auto getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() -> uint64_t {
   14578         106 :         return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>( std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch() ).count();
   14579             :     }
   14580             : 
   14581             :     namespace {
   14582           0 :         auto estimateClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   14583           0 :             uint64_t sum = 0;
   14584             :             static const uint64_t iterations = 1000000;
   14585             : 
   14586           0 :             auto startTime = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14587             : 
   14588           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < iterations; ++i ) {
   14589             : 
   14590             :                 uint64_t ticks;
   14591           0 :                 uint64_t baseTicks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14592           0 :                 do {
   14593           0 :                     ticks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14594           0 :                 } while( ticks == baseTicks );
   14595             : 
   14596           0 :                 auto delta = ticks - baseTicks;
   14597           0 :                 sum += delta;
   14598             : 
   14599             :                 // If we have been calibrating for over 3 seconds -- the clock
   14600             :                 // is terrible and we should move on.
   14601             :                 // TBD: How to signal that the measured resolution is probably wrong?
   14602           0 :                 if (ticks > startTime + 3 * nanosecondsInSecond) {
   14603           0 :                     return sum / ( i + 1u );
   14604             :                 }
   14605             :             }
   14606             : 
   14607             :             // We're just taking the mean, here. To do better we could take the std. dev and exclude outliers
   14608             :             // - and potentially do more iterations if there's a high variance.
   14609           0 :             return sum/iterations;
   14610             :         }
   14611             :     }
   14612           0 :     auto getEstimatedClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   14613           0 :         static auto s_resolution = estimateClockResolution();
   14614           0 :         return s_resolution;
   14615             :     }
   14616             : 
   14617          53 :     void Timer::start() {
   14618          53 :        m_nanoseconds = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14619          53 :     }
   14620          53 :     auto Timer::getElapsedNanoseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   14621          53 :         return getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() - m_nanoseconds;
   14622             :     }
   14623          53 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMicroseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   14624          53 :         return getElapsedNanoseconds()/1000;
   14625             :     }
   14626           0 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMilliseconds() const -> unsigned int {
   14627           0 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000);
   14628             :     }
   14629          53 :     auto Timer::getElapsedSeconds() const -> double {
   14630          53 :         return getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000000.0;
   14631             :     }
   14632             :

   14658             :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
   14659             : 
   14660             :         struct Endianness {
   14661             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
   14662             : 
   14663           0 :             static Arch which() {
   14664             :                 union _{
   14665             :                     int asInt;
   14666             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
   14667             :                 } u;
   14668             : 
   14669           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
   14670           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
   14671             :             }
   14672             :         };
   14673             :     }
   14674             : 
   14675           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size ) {
   14676             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
   14677           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
   14678           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
   14679           0 :             i = end-1;
   14680           0 :             end = inc = -1;
   14681             :         }
   14682             : 
   14683           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
   14684           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   14685           0 :         rss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
   14686           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
   14687           0 :              rss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
   14688           0 :        return rss.str();
   14689             :     }
   14690             : }
   14691             : 
   14692             : template<typename T>
   14693           0 : std::string fpToString( T value, int precision ) {
   14694           0 :     if (Catch::isnan(value)) {
   14695           0 :         return "nan";
   14696             :     }
   14697             : 
   14698           0 :     ReusableStringStream rss;

   14700           0 :         << std::fixed
   14701             :         << value;

   14703           0 :     std::size_t i = d.find_last_not_of( '0' );
   14704           0 :     if( i != std::string::npos && i != d.size()-1 ) {
   14705           0 :         if( d[i] == '.' )
   14706           0 :             i++;
   14707           0 :         d = d.substr( 0, i+1 );
   14708             :     }
   14709           0 :     return d;
   14710             : }

   15000           0 :     WildcardPattern::WildcardPattern( std::string const& pattern,
   15001           0 :                                       CaseSensitive::Choice caseSensitivity )
   15002             :     :   m_caseSensitivity( caseSensitivity ),
   15003           0 :         m_pattern( normaliseString( pattern ) )
   15004             :     {
   15005           0 :         if( startsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
   15006           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 1 );
   15007           0 :             m_wildcard = WildcardAtStart;
   15008             :         }

   15010           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );
   15011           0 :             m_wildcard = static_cast<WildcardPosition>( m_wildcard | WildcardAtEnd );
   15012             :         }
   15013           0 :     }
   15014             : 
   15015           0 :     bool WildcardPattern::matches( std::string const& str ) const {
   15016           0 :         switch( m_wildcard ) {
   15017           0 :             case NoWildcard:
   15018           0 :                 return m_pattern == normaliseString( str );
   15019           0 :             case WildcardAtStart:
   15020           0 :                 return endsWith( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
   15021           0 :             case WildcardAtEnd:
   15022           0 :                 return startsWith( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
   15023           0 :             case WildcardAtBothEnds:
   15024           0 :                 return contains( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
   15025           0 :             default:
   15026           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown enum" );
   15027             :         }
   15028             :     }
   15029             : 
   15030           0 :     std::string WildcardPattern::normaliseString( std::string const& str ) const {
   15031           0 :         return trim( m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str );
   15032             :     }
   15033             : }

   15039             : using uchar = unsigned char;
   15040             : 
   15041             : namespace Catch {
   15042             : 
   15043             : namespace {
   15044             : 
   15045           0 :     size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
   15046           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   15047           0 :             return 2;
   15048             :         }
   15049           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   15050           0 :             return 3;
   15051             :         }
   15052           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   15053           0 :             return 4;
   15054             :         }
   15055           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   15056             :     }
   15057             : 
   15058           0 :     uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
   15059           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   15060           0 :             return c & 0x1F;
   15061             :         }
   15062           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   15063           0 :             return c & 0x0F;
   15064             :         }
   15065           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   15066           0 :             return c & 0x07;
   15067             :         }
   15068           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   15069             :     }
   15070             : 
   15071           0 :     void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
   15072           0 :         std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
   15073           0 :         os << "\\x"
   15074           0 :             << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
   15075           0 :             << static_cast<int>(c);
   15076           0 :         os.flags(f);
   15077           0 :     }
   15078             : 
   15079             : } // anonymous namespace
   15080             : 
   15081           0 :     XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
   15082             :     :   m_str( str ),
   15083           0 :         m_forWhat( forWhat )
   15084           0 :     {}
   15085             : 
   15086           0 :     void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
   15087             :         // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
   15088             :         // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
   15089             : 
   15090           0 :         for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
   15091           0 :             uchar c = m_str[idx];
   15092           0 :             switch (c) {
   15093           0 :             case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
   15094           0 :             case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
   15095             : 
   15096           0 :             case '>':
   15097             :                 // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
   15098           0 :                 if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
   15099           0 :                     os << "&gt;";
   15100             :                 else
   15101           0 :                     os << c;
   15102           0 :                 break;
   15103             : 
   15104           0 :             case '\"':
   15105           0 :                 if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
   15106           0 :                     os << "&quot;";
   15107             :                 else
   15108           0 :                     os << c;
   15109           0 :                 break;
   15110             : 
   15111           0 :             default:
   15112             :                 // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
   15113             : 
   15114             :                 // Escape control characters in standard ascii
   15115             :                 // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
   15116           0 :                 if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
   15117           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15118           0 :                     break;
   15119             :                 }
   15120             : 
   15121             :                 // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
   15122           0 :                 if (c < 0x7F) {
   15123           0 :                     os << c;
   15124           0 :                     break;
   15125             :                 }
   15126             : 
   15127             :                 // UTF-8 territory
   15128             :                 // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
   15129             :                 // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
   15130             :                 // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
   15131             :                 // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
   15132             :                 // Or as 10XX XXXX
   15133           0 :                 if (c <  0xC0 ||
   15134             :                     c >= 0xF8) {
   15135           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15136           0 :                     break;
   15137             :                 }
   15138             : 
   15139           0 :                 auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
   15140             :                 // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
   15141           0 :                 if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
   15142           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15143           0 :                     break;
   15144             :                 }
   15145             :                 // The header is valid, check data
   15146             :                 // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
   15147             :                 // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
   15148           0 :                 bool valid = true;
   15149           0 :                 uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
   15150           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   15151           0 :                     uchar nc = m_str[idx + n];
   15152           0 :                     valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
   15153           0 :                     value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
   15154             :                 }
   15155             : 
   15156           0 :                 if (
   15157             :                     // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
   15158           0 :                     (!valid) ||
   15159             :                     // Overlong encodings
   15160           0 :                     (value < 0x80) ||
   15161           0 :                     (0x80 <= value && value < 0x800   && encBytes > 2) ||
   15162           0 :                     (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
   15163             :                     // Encoded value out of range
   15164             :                     (value >= 0x110000)
   15165             :                     ) {
   15166           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15167           0 :                     break;
   15168             :                 }
   15169             : 
   15170             :                 // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
   15171           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   15172           0 :                     os << m_str[idx + n];
   15173             :                 }
   15174           0 :                 idx += encBytes - 1;
   15175           0 :                 break;
   15176             :             }
   15177             :         }
   15178           0 :     }
   15179             : 
   15180           0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
   15181           0 :         xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
   15182           0 :         return os;
   15183             :     }

   15238           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement() {
   15239           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();

   15241           0 :         if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   15242           0 :             m_os << "/>";
   15243           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;
   15244             :         }
   15245             :         else {
   15246           0 :             m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
   15247             :         }
   15248           0 :         m_os << std::endl;
   15249           0 :         m_tags.pop_back();

   15264           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
   15265           0 :         if( !text.empty() ){
   15266           0 :             bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
   15267           0 :             ensureTagClosed();

   15269           0 :                 m_os << m_indent;
   15270           0 :             m_os << XmlEncode( text );
   15271           0 :             m_needsNewline = true;
   15272             :         }
   15273           0 :         return *this;
   15274             :     }
   15275             :

   15321           0 :     void prepareExpandedExpression(AssertionResult& result) {
   15322           0 :         result.getExpandedExpression();
   15323           0 :     }
   15324             : 
   15325             :     // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
   15326             :     // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
   15327           0 :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   15328             :         // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   15329             :         // + 1 for decimal point
   15330             :         // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   15331             :         // + 1 for null terminator
   15332           0 :         const std::size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   15333             :         char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   15334             : 
   15335             :         // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
   15336           0 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
   15337             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   15338             :         sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   15339             : #else
   15340           0 :         std::sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   15341             : #endif
   15342           0 :         return std::string(buffer);
   15343             :     }
   15344             :

   15354             :

   15390           0 :     std::string bothOrAll( std::size_t count ) {
   15391             :         return count == 1 ? std::string() :
   15392           0 :                count == 2 ? "both " : "all " ;
   15393             :     }

   15397             : namespace Catch {
   15398             : namespace {
   15399             : // Colour, message variants:
   15400             : // - white: No tests ran.
   15401             : // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   15402             : // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   15403             : // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   15404             : // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   15405           0 : void printTotals(std::ostream& out, const Totals& totals) {
   15406           0 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   15407           0 :         out << "No tests ran.";
   15408           0 :     } else if (totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total()) {
   15409           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   15410             :         const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   15411           0 :             totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   15412           0 :             bothOrAll(totals.assertions.failed) : std::string();
   15413             :         out <<
   15414           0 :             "Failed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.failed)
   15415           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   15416           0 :             "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   15417           0 :             pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   15418           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() == 0) {
   15419             :         out <<
   15420           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.total())
   15421           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.total(), "test case")
   15422           0 :             << " (no assertions).";
   15423           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.failed) {
   15424           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   15425             :         out <<
   15426           0 :             "Failed " << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   15427           0 :             "failed " << pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   15428             :     } else {
   15429           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultSuccess);
   15430             :         out <<
   15431           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.passed)
   15432           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") <<
   15433           0 :             " with " << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << '.';
   15434             :     }
   15435           0 : }
   15436             : 
   15437             : // Implementation of CompactReporter formatting
   15438           0 : class AssertionPrinter {
   15439             : public:
   15440             :     AssertionPrinter& operator= (AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15441             :     AssertionPrinter(AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15442           0 :     AssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   15443           0 :         : stream(_stream)
   15444             :         , result(_stats.assertionResult)
   15445             :         , messages(_stats.infoMessages)
   15446           0 :         , itMessage(_stats.infoMessages.begin())
   15447           0 :         , printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {}
   15448             : 
   15449           0 :     void print() {
   15450           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   15451             : 
   15452           0 :         itMessage = messages.begin();
   15453             : 
   15454           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   15455           0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   15456           0 :             printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, passedString());
   15457           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15458           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15459           0 :             if (!result.hasExpression())
   15460           0 :                 printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   15461             :             else
   15462           0 :                 printRemainingMessages();
   15463           0 :             break;
   15464           0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   15465           0 :             if (result.isOk())
   15466           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, failedString() + std::string(" - but was ok"));
   15467             :             else
   15468           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15469           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15470           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15471           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15472           0 :             break;
   15473           0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   15474           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15475           0 :             printIssue("unexpected exception with message:");
   15476           0 :             printMessage();
   15477           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15478           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15479           0 :             break;
   15480           0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   15481           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15482           0 :             printIssue("fatal error condition with message:");
   15483           0 :             printMessage();
   15484           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15485           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15486           0 :             break;
   15487           0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   15488           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15489           0 :             printIssue("expected exception, got none");
   15490           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15491           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15492           0 :             break;
   15493           0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
   15494           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "info");
   15495           0 :             printMessage();
   15496           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15497           0 :             break;
   15498           0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   15499           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "warning");
   15500           0 :             printMessage();
   15501           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15502           0 :             break;
   15503           0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   15504           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15505           0 :             printIssue("explicitly");
   15506           0 :             printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   15507           0 :             break;
   15508             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   15509           0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   15510             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   15511             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   15512           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, "** internal error **");
   15513           0 :             break;
   15514             :         }
   15515           0 :     }
   15516             : 
   15517             : private:
   15518           0 :     void printSourceInfo() const {

   15520           0 :         stream << result.getSourceInfo() << ':';
   15521           0 :     }
   15522             :

   15524           0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
   15525             :             {
   15526           0 :                 Colour colourGuard(colour);

   15534           0 :         stream << ' ' << issue;
   15535           0 :     }
   15536             : 
   15537           0 :     void printExpressionWas() {
   15538           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   15539           0 :             stream << ';';
   15540             :             {
   15541           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());

   15543             :             }
   15544           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15545             :         }
   15546           0 :     }
   15547             : 
   15548           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
   15549           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   15550           0 :             stream << ' ' << result.getExpression();
   15551             :         }
   15552           0 :     }
   15553             : 
   15554           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   15555           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   15556             :             {
   15557           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());
   15558           0 :                 stream << " for: ";
   15559             :             }
   15560           0 :             stream << result.getExpandedExpression();
   15561             :         }
   15562           0 :     }
   15563             : 
   15564           0 :     void printMessage() {
   15565           0 :         if (itMessage != messages.end()) {
   15566           0 :             stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   15567           0 :             ++itMessage;
   15568             :         }
   15569           0 :     }
   15570             : 
   15571           0 :     void printRemainingMessages(Colour::Code colour = dimColour()) {
   15572           0 :         if (itMessage == messages.end())
   15573           0 :             return;
   15574             : 
   15575           0 :         const auto itEnd = messages.cend();
   15576           0 :         const auto N = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(itMessage, itEnd));
   15577             : 
   15578             :         {
   15579           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   15580           0 :             stream << " with " << pluralise(N, "message") << ':';
   15581             :         }
   15582             : 
   15583           0 :         while (itMessage != itEnd) {
   15584             :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   15585           0 :             if (printInfoMessages || itMessage->type != ResultWas::Info) {
   15586           0 :                 printMessage();
   15587           0 :                 if (itMessage != itEnd) {
   15588           0 :                     Colour colourGuard(dimColour());
   15589           0 :                     stream << " and";
   15590             :                 }
   15591           0 :                 continue;
   15592             :             }
   15593           0 :             ++itMessage;
   15594             :         }
   15595             :     }
   15596             : 
   15597             : private:
   15598             :     std::ostream& stream;

   15679             : // Formatter impl for ConsoleReporter
   15680           0 : class ConsoleAssertionPrinter {
   15681             : public:
   15682             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter& operator= (ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15683             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15684           0 :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   15685           0 :         : stream(_stream),
   15686             :         stats(_stats),
   15687             :         result(_stats.assertionResult),
   15688             :         colour(Colour::None),
   15689           0 :         message(result.getMessage()),
   15690             :         messages(_stats.infoMessages),
   15691           0 :         printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {
   15692           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   15693           0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   15694           0 :             colour = Colour::Success;
   15695           0 :             passOrFail = "PASSED";
   15696             :             //if( result.hasMessage() )
   15697           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15698           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   15699           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15700           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   15701           0 :             break;
   15702           0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   15703           0 :             if (result.isOk()) {
   15704           0 :                 colour = Colour::Success;
   15705           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok";
   15706             :             } else {
   15707           0 :                 colour = Colour::Error;
   15708           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15709             :             }
   15710           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15711           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   15712           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15713           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   15714           0 :             break;
   15715           0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   15716           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15717           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15718           0 :             messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with ";
   15719           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15720           0 :                 messageLabel += "message";
   15721           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15722           0 :                 messageLabel += "messages";
   15723           0 :             break;
   15724           0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   15725           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15726           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15727           0 :             messageLabel = "due to a fatal error condition";
   15728           0 :             break;
   15729           0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   15730           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15731           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15732           0 :             messageLabel = "because no exception was thrown where one was expected";
   15733           0 :             break;
   15734           0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
   15735           0 :             messageLabel = "info";
   15736           0 :             break;
   15737           0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   15738           0 :             messageLabel = "warning";
   15739           0 :             break;
   15740           0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   15741           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15742           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15743           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15744           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with message";
   15745           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15746           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with messages";
   15747           0 :             break;
   15748             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   15749           0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   15750             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   15751             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   15752           0 :             passOrFail = "** internal error **";
   15753           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15754           0 :             break;
   15755             :         }
   15756           0 :     }
   15757             : 
   15758           0 :     void print() const {
   15759           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   15760           0 :         if (stats.totals.assertions.total() > 0) {
   15761           0 :             printResultType();
   15762           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15763           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15764             :         } else {
   15765           0 :             stream << '\n';
   15766             :         }
   15767           0 :         printMessage();
   15768           0 :     }
   15769             : 
   15770             : private:
   15771           0 :     void printResultType() const {
   15772           0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
   15773           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   15774           0 :             stream << passOrFail << ":\n";
   15775             :         }
   15776           0 :     }
   15777           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
   15778           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   15779           0 :             Colour colourGuard(Colour::OriginalExpression);
   15780           0 :             stream << "  ";
   15781           0 :             stream << result.getExpressionInMacro();
   15782           0 :             stream << '\n';
   15783             :         }
   15784           0 :     }
   15785           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   15786           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   15787           0 :             stream << "with expansion:\n";
   15788           0 :             Colour colourGuard(Colour::ReconstructedExpression);
   15789           0 :             stream << Column(result.getExpandedExpression()).indent(2) << '\n';
   15790             :         }
   15791           0 :     }
   15792           0 :     void printMessage() const {
   15793           0 :         if (!messageLabel.empty())
   15794           0 :             stream << messageLabel << ':' << '\n';
   15795           0 :         for (auto const& msg : messages) {
   15796             :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   15797           0 :             if (printInfoMessages || msg.type != ResultWas::Info)
   15798           0 :                 stream << Column(msg.message).indent(2) << '\n';
   15799             :         }
   15800           0 :     }
   15801           0 :     void printSourceInfo() const {
   15802           0 :         Colour colourGuard(Colour::FileName);
   15803           0 :         stream << result.getSourceInfo() << ": ";
   15804           0 :     }
   15805             : 
   15806             :     std::ostream& stream;

   15814             :     bool printInfoMessages;

   15816             : 
   15817           3 : std::size_t makeRatio(std::size_t number, std::size_t total) {
   15818           3 :     std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number / total : 0;
   15819           3 :     return (ratio == 0 && number > 0) ? 1 : ratio;
   15820             : }
   15821             : 
   15822           1 : std::size_t& findMax(std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k) {
   15823           1 :     if (i > j && i > k)
   15824           0 :         return i;
   15825           1 :     else if (j > k)
   15826           0 :         return j;
   15827             :     else
   15828           1 :         return k;
   15829             : }
   15830             : 
   15831          12 : struct ColumnInfo {
   15832             :     enum Justification { Left, Right };
   15833             :     std::string name;
   15834             :     int width;
   15835             :     Justification justification;
   15836             : };
   15837             : struct ColumnBreak {};
   15838             : struct RowBreak {};
   15839             : 
   15840             : class Duration {
   15841             :     enum class Unit {
   15842             :         Auto,
   15843             :         Nanoseconds,
   15844             :         Microseconds,
   15845             :         Milliseconds,
   15846             :         Seconds,
   15847             :         Minutes
   15848             :     };
   15849             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond = 1000;
   15850             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond;
   15851             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInASecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond;
   15852             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMinute = 60 * s_nanosecondsInASecond;
   15853             : 
   15854             :     uint64_t m_inNanoseconds;
   15855             :     Unit m_units;
   15856             : 
   15857             : public:
   15858             :         explicit Duration(double inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   15859             :         : Duration(static_cast<uint64_t>(inNanoseconds), units) {
   15860             :     }
   15861             : 
   15862             :     explicit Duration(uint64_t inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   15863             :         : m_inNanoseconds(inNanoseconds),
   15864             :         m_units(units) {
   15865             :         if (m_units == Unit::Auto) {
   15866             :             if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond)
   15867             :                 m_units = Unit::Nanoseconds;
   15868             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond)
   15869             :                 m_units = Unit::Microseconds;
   15870             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInASecond)
   15871             :                 m_units = Unit::Milliseconds;
   15872             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMinute)
   15873             :                 m_units = Unit::Seconds;
   15874             :             else
   15875             :                 m_units = Unit::Minutes;
   15876             :         }
   15877             : 
   15878             :     }
   15879             : 
   15880             :     auto value() const -> double {
   15881             :         switch (m_units) {
   15882             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   15883             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond);
   15884             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   15885             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond);
   15886             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   15887             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInASecond);
   15888             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   15889             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMinute);
   15890             :         default:
   15891             :             return static_cast<double>(m_inNanoseconds);
   15892             :         }
   15893             :     }
   15894             :     auto unitsAsString() const -> std::string {
   15895             :         switch (m_units) {
   15896             :         case Unit::Nanoseconds:
   15897             :             return "ns";
   15898             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   15899             :             return "us";
   15900             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   15901             :             return "ms";
   15902             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   15903             :             return "s";
   15904             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   15905             :             return "m";
   15906             :         default:
   15907             :             return "** internal error **";
   15908             :         }
   15909             : 
   15910             :     }
   15911             :     friend auto operator << (std::ostream& os, Duration const& duration) -> std::ostream& {
   15912             :         return os << duration.value() << ' ' << duration.unitsAsString();
   15913             :     }

   16243             :         }

   16254           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
   16255           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   16256           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "No tests ran\n";
   16257           1 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed()) {

   16259           1 :         stream << " ("
   16260           2 :             << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << " in "
   16261           2 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") << ')'
   16262           1 :             << '\n';
   16263             :     } else {
   16264             : 
   16265           0 :         std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;
   16266           0 :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("", Colour::None)
   16267           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.total())
   16268           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.total()));

   16271           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.passed));

   16273           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.failed)
   16274           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.failed));
   16275           0 :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("failed as expected", Colour::ResultExpectedFailure)

   16279           0 :         printSummaryRow("test cases", columns, 0);
   16280           0 :         printSummaryRow("assertions", columns, 1);
   16281             :     }
   16282           1 : }
   16283           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryRow(std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row) {

   16285           0 :         std::string value = col.rows[row];

   16287           0 :             stream << label << ": ";
   16288           0 :             if (value != "0")
   16289           0 :                 stream << value;
   16290             :             else
   16291           0 :                 stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "- none -";
   16292           0 :         } else if (value != "0") {
   16293           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::LightGrey) << " | ";
   16294           0 :             stream << Colour(col.colour)
   16295           0 :                 << value << ' ' << col.label;
   16296             :         }

   16300             : 
   16301           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotalsDivider(Totals const& totals) {
   16302           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() > 0) {
   16303           1 :         std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total());
   16304           1 :         std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total());
   16305           1 :         std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total());
   16306           1 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   16307           0 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)++;
   16308           3 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   16309           1 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)--;
   16310             : 
   16311           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Error) << std::string(failedRatio, '=');
   16312           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultExpectedFailure) << std::string(failedButOkRatio, '=');
   16313           1 :         if (totals.testCases.allPassed())
   16314           1 :             stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   16315             :         else
   16316           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::Success) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   16317             :     } else {
   16318           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << std::string(CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1, '=');
   16319             :     }
   16320           1 :     stream << '\n';
   16321           1 : }
   16322           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryDivider() {
   16323           0 :     stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << '\n';
   16324           0 : }

   16353           0 :         std::string getCurrentTimestamp() {
   16354             :             // Beware, this is not reentrant because of backward compatibility issues
   16355             :             // Also, UTC only, again because of backward compatibility (%z is C++11)
   16356             :             time_t rawtime;
   16357           0 :             std::time(&rawtime);
   16358           0 :             auto const timeStampSize = sizeof("2017-01-16T17:06:45Z");
   16359             : 
   16360             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   16361             :             std::tm timeInfo = {};
   16362             :             gmtime_s(&timeInfo, &rawtime);
   16363             : #else
   16364             :             std::tm* timeInfo;
   16365           0 :             timeInfo = std::gmtime(&rawtime);
   16366             : #endif
   16367             : 
   16368             :             char timeStamp[timeStampSize];
   16369           0 :             const char * const fmt = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ";
   16370             : 
   16371             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   16372             :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, &timeInfo);
   16373             : #else
   16374           0 :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, timeInfo);
   16375             : #endif
   16376           0 :             return std::string(timeStamp);
   16377             :         }

   16379           0 :         std::string fileNameTag(const std::vector<std::string> &tags) {
   16380             :             auto it = std::find_if(begin(tags),
   16381             :                                    end(tags),
   16382           0 :                                    [] (std::string const& tag) {return tag.front() == '#'; });

   16384           0 :                 return it->substr(1);
   16385           0 :             return std::string();
   16386             :         }

   16444           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeGroup( TestGroupNode const& groupNode, double suiteTime ) {

   16482           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeTestCase( TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode ) {

   16504           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeSection(  std::string const& className,

   16544           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertion( AssertionStats const& stats ) {
   16545           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   16546           0 :         if( !result.isOk() ) {
   16547           0 :             std::string elementName;
   16548           0 :             switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   16549           0 :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   16550             :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   16551           0 :                     elementName = "error";
   16552           0 :                     break;
   16553           0 :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   16554           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   16555           0 :                     break;
   16556           0 :                 case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   16557           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   16558           0 :                     break;
   16559           0 :                 case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   16560           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   16561           0 :                     break;
   16562             : 
   16563             :                 // We should never see these here:
   16564           0 :                 case ResultWas::Info:
   16565             :                 case ResultWas::Warning:
   16566             :                 case ResultWas::Ok:
   16567             :                 case ResultWas::Unknown:
   16568             :                 case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   16569             :                 case ResultWas::Exception:
   16570           0 :                     elementName = "internalError";
   16571           0 :                     break;
   16572             :             }
   16573             : 
   16574           0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( elementName );
   16575             : 
   16576           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "message", result.getExpandedExpression() );
   16577           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   16578             : 
   16579           0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   16580           0 :             if( !result.getMessage().empty() )
   16581           0 :                 rss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   16582           0 :             for( auto const& msg : stats.infoMessages )
   16583           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info )
   16584           0 :                     rss << msg.message << '\n';
   16585             : 
   16586           0 :             rss << "at " << result.getSourceInfo();
   16587           0 :             xml.writeText( rss.str(), false );
   16588             :         }
   16589           0 :     }

   16833           0 :     void XmlReporter::assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) { }

   16835           0 :     bool XmlReporter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) {
   16836             : 
   16837           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = assertionStats.assertionResult;
   16838             : 
   16839           0 :         bool includeResults = m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() || !result.isOk();
   16840             : 
   16841           0 :         if( includeResults || result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   16842             :             // Print any info messages in <Info> tags.
   16843           0 :             for( auto const& msg : assertionStats.infoMessages ) {
   16844           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info && includeResults ) {
   16845           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   16846           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   16847           0 :                 } else if ( msg.type == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   16848           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Warning" )
   16849           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   16850             :                 }
   16851             :             }
   16852             :         }
   16853             : 
   16854             :         // Drop out if result was successful but we're not printing them.
   16855           0 :         if( !includeResults && result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   16856           0 :             return true;
   16857             : 
   16858             :         // Print the expression if there is one.
   16859           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   16860           0 :             m_xml.startElement( "Expression" )
   16861           0 :                 .writeAttribute( "success", result.succeeded() )
   16862           0 :                 .writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   16863             : 
   16864           0 :             writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   16865             : 
   16866           0 :             m_xml.scopedElement( "Original" )
   16867           0 :                 .writeText( result.getExpression() );
   16868           0 :             m_xml.scopedElement( "Expanded" )
   16869           0 :                 .writeText( result.getExpandedExpression() );
   16870             :         }
   16871             : 
   16872             :         // And... Print a result applicable to each result type.
   16873           0 :         switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   16874           0 :             case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   16875           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Exception" );
   16876           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   16877           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   16878           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   16879           0 :                 break;
   16880           0 :             case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   16881           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "FatalErrorCondition" );
   16882           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   16883           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   16884           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   16885           0 :                 break;
   16886           0 :             case ResultWas::Info:
   16887           0 :                 m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   16888           0 :                     .writeText( result.getMessage() );
   16889           0 :                 break;
   16890           0 :             case ResultWas::Warning:
   16891             :                 // Warning will already have been written
   16892           0 :                 break;
   16893           0 :             case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   16894           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Failure" );
   16895           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   16896           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   16897           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   16898           0 :                 break;
   16899           0 :             default:
   16900           0 :                 break;
   16901             :         }
   16902             : 
   16903           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() )
   16904           0 :             m_xml.endElement();
   16905             : 
   16906           0 :         return true;
   16907             :     }
   16908             : 
   16909           0 :     void XmlReporter::sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) {
   16910           0 :         StreamingReporterBase::sectionEnded( sectionStats );

   17152             : #define CATCH_SCENARIO_METHOD( className, ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST_CASE_METHOD( className, "Scenario: " __VA_ARGS__ )
